subject: Developments
msgSnippet: Do guys remember a while back when some of us were discussing transcribing the classics into Quickscript? Well, after a bit of creative hackery (find/replace
messageBody: Do guys remember a while back when some of us were discussing transcribing the classics into Quickscript? Well, after a bit of creative hackery (find/replace all ad nauseum) I have the World English Bible nearly 80% in Quickscript. Running low on common words, the true fun is soon to start. If anyone has the interest and time, it would be amazing if they could adopt a book or two and sculpt the remaining bits of non-markup Latin away. I chose a USFMed file compatible with the very capable program Bibledit to make versification and layout a non-issue. The Quickscript text follows the Kingsley Unicode scheme so an input method that supports it is key. Aside from that, come one come all to the virtual transcribing hall.

Do guys remember a while back when some of us were discussing transcribing =
the classics into Quickscript? Well, after a bit of creative hackery (find/=
replace all ad nauseum) I have the World English Bible nearly 80% in Quicks=
cript. Running low on common words, the true fun is soon to start. If anyon=
e has the interest and time, it would be amazing if they could adopt a book=
 or two and sculpt the remaining bits of non-markup Latin away. I chose a U=
SFMed file compatible with the very capable program Bibledit to make versif=
ication and layout a non-issue. The Quickscript text follows the Kingsley U=
nicode scheme so an input method that supports it is key. Aside from that, =
come one come all to the virtual transcribing hall.
